skills.label: Understand device drivers
items: Installation, removal, disabling, update/upgrade, rollback, troubleshooting, plug & play, irq, interrupts, driver signing, managing through group policy

skills.label: Understand services
items: Which statuses a service can be in, startup types, recovery options, delayed startup, run as settings for a service, stopping or pausing a service, service accounts, dependencies

skills.label: Understand server installation options
items: Choose the correct operating system version options
Server core vs. desktop experience, nano server installation, interactive installs
Automated install using wds
Vhd/vhdx installation source, perform unattended installs
Perform upgrades, clean installs, and migrations

skills.label: Identify application servers
items: Mail servers, database servers, collaboration servers, monitoring servers, threat management

skills.label: Understand Web services
items: Iis, www, and ftp, installing from server manager, separate worker processes, adding components, sites, ports, ssl, certificates

skills.label: Understand remote access
items: Remote assistance, remote administration tools, remote desktop services, multipoint services, licensing, rd gateway, vpn, application virtualization, multiple ports

skills.label: Understand the file and print services
items: Local printers, network printers, printer pools, web printing, web management, driver deployment, file, folder, and share permissions vs. rights, auditing, print job management

skills.label: Understand server virtualization
items: Virtual memory, virtual networks, snapshots and saved states, physical to virtual conversions, virtual to physical conversions, vhd and vhdx formats, nested virtualization

skills.label: Understand accounts and groups
items: Domain accounts, local accounts, user profiles, computer accounts, group types, default groups, group scopes, group nesting, understand agdlp and agudlp processes to help implement nesting

skills.label: Understand organizational units and containers
items: Purpose of ous, purpose of containers, delegation, default containers, uses for different container objects, default hidden and visible containers

skills.label: Understand Active Directory infrastructure
items: Domain controllers. forests, child domains, operation master roles, domain vs. workgroup, trust relationships, functional levels, deprecated functional levels, namespace, sites, replication, schema, passport

skills.label: Understand group policy
items: Group policy processing, group policy management console, computer policies, user policies, local policies

skills.label: Identify storage technologies and their typical usage scenarios
items: Advantages and disadvantages of different storage topologies, local storage, network storage, fibre channel, iscsi hardware

skills.label: Understand RAID redundancy
items: Raid 0, raid 1, raid 5, raid 10 and combinations, hardware and software raid

skills.label: Understand disk types
items: Solid state drive (ssd) and hard disk drive (hdd) types and comparisons, ata basic disk, dynamic disk, mount points, file systems, mounting a virtual hard disk, distributed file systems

skills.label: Identify major server hardware components
items: Memory, disk, processor, network, 32-bit and 64-bit architecture, removable drives, graphic cards, cooling, power usage, ports

skills.label: Understand performance monitoring
items: Methodology, procedures, effect of network, cpu, memory and disk, creating a baseline, performance monitor, resource monitor, task manager, performance counters, data collector sets

skills.label: Understand logs and alerts, Event Viewer
items: Purpose of performance logs and alerts

skills.label: Identify steps in the startup process
items: Bios, uefi, tpm, bootsector, bootloader, mbr, boot.ini, post, safe mode

skills.label: Understand business continuity
items: Backup and restore, disaster recovery planning, clustering, ad restore, folder redirection, data redundancy, uniterruptible power supply (ups)

skills.label: Understand updates
items: Software, driver, operating systems, applications, windows update, windows server update service (wsus)

skills.label: Understand troubleshooting methodology
items: Processes, procedures, best practices
Systematic vs. specific approach, performance monitor, event viewer, resource monitor, information technology infrastructure library, central logging, event filtering, default logs
